articles.description: USB4 will include support for DisplayPort 2.0, allowing connected displays to push as high as 16K or for multiple attached 8K displays.
articles.content: We already knew that USB4 would be a versatile standard partly derived from Intel’s Thunderbolt technology, but it looks like the upcoming standard will have more features than we knew. VESA has announced that USB4 will fully support DisplayPort 2.0 through t… [+2352 chars]

articles.title: IDC Top 5 smartphone manufacturers – Vivo bounces back - Gizchina.com
articles.description: IDC Top 5 smartphone manufacturers - Vivo bounces back. Samsung, Huawei and Apple all recorded a decline while Xiaomi and Vivo increased
articles.content: The coronavirus pandemic has a huge effect on the global smartphone market. According to IDC, the global smartphone shipments fell 11.7% year-on-year in the first quarter of 2020. However, Samsung (1st), Huawei (2nd), and Apple (3rd) still manage to retain th… [+1701 chars]

articles.author: Ryan Gilliam
articles.title: Titans aren’t cheating to win Destiny 2’s Guardian Games - Polygon
articles.description: Destiny 2’s Guardian Games have been an absolute stomp so far, with Titans winning every day but the first. But according to Bungie, their domination over Hunters and Warlocks is completely legitimate — no foul play here.
articles.content: For the last two weeks, Bungie has hosted a new seasonal holiday in Destiny 2 called Guardian Games. Players have been able to dive into Destiny 2, play the game, and vote for the best of the games three classes. However, for all but one of the days since the… [+3001 chars]

articles.description: No more tarantula island in New Horizons if you're in the Northern Hemisphere--tarantulas are now out of season, but the scorpion replaces them.
articles.content: Update: Tarantulas are now out of season for Animal Crossing: New Horizons players with Northern Hemisphere islands, replaced with the near-identical scorpion. If you have a Southern Hemisphere island, then you'll be saying hello to the tarantula for the firs… [+3129 chars]

articles.author: Bijan Stephen
articles.title: Steam ends Mac support for SteamVR - The Verge
articles.description: Steam has ended Apple support for SteamVR, though Mac users will be able to access legacy builds of the feature. SteamVR became available to Macs after 2017’s WWDC.
articles.content: Its the end of a very short era
